label: 平準署
対訳語: Division in charge of Stabilizing Rice Prices
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: In charge of the Prince-Stabilizing Granaries (Jōheisō) throughout the country. Bought and sold rice to keep prices level in Kyōto, and in order to acquire profits with which to feed and clothe those who were bringing in tribute (mitsugi) from the provinces (kuni ). Divided into Left Division (Saheijunsho) and Right Division in charge of Stabilizing Rice Prices (Uheijunsho ), the former being in charge of the Tōkaidō, Tōsandō, and Hokurokudō, the latter of the San'indō, San'yōdō, Nankaidō, and Saikaidō.
